intro: Brazzeia biseriata, commonly known as the two-rowed brazzeia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
